alert.note: Alert for Scott (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 12 at 11:02AM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Scott County through 1130 AM CDT... At 1102 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Hay-Wood City, or near Miner, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Scott County, including the following locations... Diehlstadt and Blodgett. This includes Interstate 55 between Mile Markers 72 and 77. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
